gov.nasa.jpf.autodoc.scanner

Class ArchiveReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.jpf.autodoc.scanner.ArchiveReader

  • public class ArchiveReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to read data from .zip and .jar archives.
    Author:
    Carlos Uribe

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String path)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Load an archive from a file path.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file was not found in path.

      • load

        public void load(java.io.File file)
          throws java.util.zip.ZipException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Load an archive from a Java File.
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.ZipException - if file is corrupted.
        java.io.IOException - if file was not found.

      • readArchive

        public java.util.List<byte[]> readArchive()
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          FileNotLoadedException
        Read bytes from all packaged files of an archive.
        Returns:
        a collection of bytes for each file read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something is wrong with archive.
        FileNotLoadedException - if load has not been executed yet.

      • readClassFiles

        public java.util.List<byte[]> readClassFiles()
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             FileNotLoadedException
        Read bytes from an archive of classfiles only. It is useful to get classfiles from a .jar archive.
        Returns:
        a collection of bytes for each classfile read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something is wrong with archive.
        FileNotLoadedException - if load has not been executed yet.

      • readInArchive

        public byte[] readInArchive(java.lang.String filename)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            FileNotLoadedException
        Read a single file from an archive.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something is wrong with archive.
        FileNotLoadedException - if load has not been executed yet.

      • readEntry

        public byte[] readEntry(java.util.zip.ZipFile file,
               java.util.zip.ZipEntry entry)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Read bytes from a ZipFile and a ZipEntry. Since JarFile extends ZipFile and JarEntry extends ZipEntry this method works well for both types of archives.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readFile

        public byte[] readFile(java.lang.String path)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Read bytes from a filepath on disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • readFile

        public byte[] readFile(java.io.File file)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Read bytes from a file on disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        public byte[] read(java.io.InputStream stream,
          int size)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Read bytes from an InputStream.

        NOTE - Size is not bigger than (2^32)-1 bytes to read single files because classfiles in particular don't exceed this amount and is limited to default jvm heap space.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
